verses.text: When thou goest \w out|strong="H3318"\w* to \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* against thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, and \w seest|strong="H7200"\w* \w horses|strong="H5483"\w*, and \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*, \add and\add* a \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w more|strong="H7227"\w* than thou, be not \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w* of them: for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \add is\add* with thee, which brought thee \w up|strong="H5927"\w* out of the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w*.

And it shall be, when ye are come \w nigh|strong="H7126"\w* unto the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*, that the \w priest|strong="H3548"\w* shall \w approach|strong="H5066"\w* and \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*,

And shall \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, \w Hear|strong="H8085"\w*, O \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, ye \w approach|strong="H7131"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* unto \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* against your \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*: let not your \w hearts|strong="H3824"\w* \w faint|strong="H7401"\w*, \w fear|strong="H3372"\w* not, and do not \w tremble|strong="H2648"\w*, neither be ye \w terrified|strong="H6206"\w* \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of them;\f + \fr 20.3 \ft faint: Heb. be tender\f*\f + \fr 20.3 \ft tremble: Heb. make haste\f*

For the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \add is\add* he that \w goeth|strong="H1980"\w* with you, to \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* for you against your \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, to \w save|strong="H3467"\w* you.

¶ And the \w officers|strong="H7860"\w* shall \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, What \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add is there\add* that hath \w built|strong="H1129"\w* a \w new|strong="H2319"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and hath not \w dedicated|strong="H2596"\w* it? let him \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w return|strong="H7725"\w* to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, lest he \w die|strong="H4191"\w* in the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w dedicate|strong="H2596"\w* it.

And what \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add is he\add* that hath \w planted|strong="H5193"\w* a \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*, and hath not \add yet\add* \w eaten|strong="H2490"\w* of it? let him \add also\add* \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w return|strong="H7725"\w* unto his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, lest he \w die|strong="H4191"\w* in the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w eat|strong="H2490"\w* of it.\f + \fr 20.6 \ft eaten…: Heb. made it common\f*

And what \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add is there\add* that hath \w betrothed|strong="H0781"\w* a \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and hath not \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* her? let him \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w return|strong="H7725"\w* unto his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, lest he \w die|strong="H4191"\w* in the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w take|strong="H3947"\w* her.

And the \w officers|strong="H7860"\w* shall \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* \w further|strong="H3254"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and they shall \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, What \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add is there that is\add* \w fearful|strong="H3373"\w* and \w fainthearted|strong="H7390"\w*? let him \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w return|strong="H7725"\w* unto his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, lest his \w brethren’s|strong="H0251"\w* \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* \w faint|strong="H4549"\w* as well as his \w heart|strong="H3824"\w*.\f + \fr 20.8 \ft faint: Heb. melt\f*

And it shall be, when the \w officers|strong="H7860"\w* have made an \w end|strong="H3615"\w* of \w speaking|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, that they shall \w make|strong="H6485"\w* \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w armies|strong="H6635"\w* to \w lead|strong="H7218"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.\f + \fr 20.9 \ft to lead…: Heb. to be in the head of the people\f*
¶ When thou comest \w nigh|strong="H7126"\w* unto a \w city|strong="H5892"\w* to \w fight|strong="H3898"\w* against it, then \w proclaim|strong="H7121"\w* \w peace|strong="H7965"\w* unto it.

And it shall be, if it make thee \w answer|strong="H6030"\w* of \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*, and \w open|strong="H6605"\w* unto thee, then it shall be, \add that\add* all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \add that is\add* \w found|strong="H4672"\w* therein shall be \w tributaries|strong="H4522"\w* unto thee, and they shall \w serve|strong="H5647"\w* thee.
And if it will make no \w peace|strong="H7999"\w* with thee, but will \w make|strong="H6213"\w* \w war|strong="H4421"\w* against thee, then thou shalt \w besiege|strong="H6696"\w* it:

And when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* hath \w delivered|strong="H5414"\w* it into thine \w hands|strong="H3027"\w*, thou shalt \w smite|strong="H5221"\w* every \w male|strong="H2138"\w* thereof with the \w edge|strong="H6310"\w* of the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*:

But the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, and the little \w ones|strong="H2945"\w*, and the \w cattle|strong="H0929"\w*, and all that is in the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, \add even\add* all the \w spoil|strong="H7998"\w* thereof, shalt thou \w take|strong="H0962"\w* unto thyself; and thou shalt \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* the \w spoil|strong="H7998"\w* of thine \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w*, which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* hath \w given|strong="H5414"\w* thee.\f + \fr 20.14 \ft take: Heb. spoil\f*

Thus shalt thou \w do|strong="H6213"\w* unto all the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* \add which are\add* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* far \w off|strong="H7350"\w* from thee, \w which|strong="H2007"\w* \add are\add* not of the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of these \w nations|strong="H1471"\w*.

But of the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of these \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* doth \w give|strong="H5414"\w* thee \add for\add* an \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w*, thou shalt save \w alive|strong="H2421"\w* nothing that \w breatheth|strong="H5397"\w*:

But thou shalt \w utterly|strong="H2763"\w* \w destroy|strong="H2763"\w* them; \add namely\add*, the \w Hittites|strong="H2850"\w*, and the \w Amorites|strong="H0567"\w*, the \w Canaanites|strong="H3669"\w*, and the \w Perizzites|strong="H6522"\w*, the \w Hivites|strong="H2340"\w*, and the \w Jebusites|strong="H2983"\w*; as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* hath \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* thee:

That they \w teach|strong="H3925"\w* you not to \w do|strong="H6213"\w* after all their \w abominations|strong="H8441"\w*, which they have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* unto their \w gods|strong="H0430"\w*; so should ye \w sin|strong="H2398"\w* against the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* your \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

¶ When thou shalt \w besiege|strong="H6696"\w* a \w city|strong="H5892"\w* a \w long|strong="H7227"\w* \w time|strong="H3117"\w*, in making \w war|strong="H3898"\w* against it to \w take|strong="H8610"\w* it, thou shalt not \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w* the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* thereof by \w forcing|strong="H5080"\w* an \w axe|strong="H1631"\w* against them: for thou mayest \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* of them, and thou shalt not cut them \w down|strong="H3772"\w* (for the \w tree|strong="H6086"\w* of the \w field|strong="H7704"\w* \add is\add* \w man’s|strong="H0120"\w* \add life\add*) to \w employ|strong="H0935"\w* \add them\add* in the \w siege|strong="H6440"\w*:\f + \fr 20.19 \ft for the…: or, for, O man, the tree of the field is to be employed in the siege\f*\f + \fr 20.19 \ft to employ…: Heb. to go from before thee\f*

Only the \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* which thou \w knowest|strong="H3045"\w* that they \add be\add* not \w trees|strong="H6086"\w* for \w meat|strong="H3978"\w*, thou shalt \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w* and cut them \w down|strong="H3772"\w*; and thou shalt \w build|strong="H1129"\w* \w bulwarks|strong="H4692"\w* against the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* that \w maketh|strong="H6213"\w* \w war|strong="H4421"\w* with thee, until it be \w subdued|strong="H3381"\w*.\f + \fr 20.20 \ft it…: Heb. it come down\f*
